Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cell electrodes with directional properties have shown their potential to get the maximum electrochemical reaction sites, gas diffusivity and ionic conductivity, simultaneously.
Titulo: Geometric Modeling of Infiltrated Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrodes with Directional Backbones

Sentencas: New manufacturing methods, like freeze type casting, have used to make this kind on electrodes.
Titulo: Geometric Modeling of Infiltrated Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrodes with Directional Backbones

Sentencas: In this work, the effect of backbone directional behavior in infiltrated solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) was simulated.
Titulo: Geometric Modeling of Infiltrated Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrodes with Directional Backbones

Sentencas: A series of directional backbones were generated by a statistical method and analyzed in regard of available active surface density and phase tortuosity.
Titulo: Geometric Modeling of Infiltrated Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrodes with Directional Backbones

Sentencas: Different amount of electrocatalyst particles virtually deposited on the surface of those scaffolds.
Titulo: Geometric Modeling of Infiltrated Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrodes with Directional Backbones

Sentencas: Some geometric parameters like triple phase boundary (TPB) density, active surface density of particles and the pore tortuosity were extracted from those realized models.
Titulo: Geometric Modeling of Infiltrated Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrodes with Directional Backbones

Sentencas: The simulations showed that the optimum amount of infiltration to get the maximum TPB density or active surface density of impregnated particles can be varied depend on the porosity and geometric anisotropy of scaffolds.
Titulo: Geometric Modeling of Infiltrated Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrodes with Directional Backbones

Sentencas: Being directional in backbones, normal to the electrolyte, has a positive effect on active electrochemical sites especially active surface density of deposited particles.
Titulo: Geometric Modeling of Infiltrated Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrodes with Directional Backbones

Sentencas: Also it can improve the gas transport even in low porosity microstructures, but adding electrocatalyst particles may increase the pore tortuosity considerably.
Titulo: Geometric Modeling of Infiltrated Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrodes with Directional Backbones

Sentencas: Accordingly, directional backbones have the potential of increasing the performance of infiltrated electrodes via adding electrochemical sites and gas diffusivity.
Titulo: Geometric Modeling of Infiltrated Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrodes with Directional Backbones
